Word_Entry.question: Can you find Nanay?
Word_Entry.hint: She makes delicious adobo. Very tasty!
Word_Entry.notes: She is my mother. She usually cooks for the family.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Tatay?
Word_Entry.hint: He was the one that made our treehouse in the backyard.
Word_Entry.notes: He is my father. He works for the family.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Kuya?
Word_Entry.hint: He also teases me a lot.
Word_Entry.notes: He is my older brother. He likes to play basketball.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Ate?
Word_Entry.hint: She told me she really likes this boy once. I forgot his name.
Word_Entry.notes: She is my older sister. She spends a lot of her time talking with her friends.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Lolo?
Word_Entry.hint: We play board games a lot.
Word_Entry.notes: He is Tatay's father. He uses glasses to read the newspaper.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Lola?
Word_Entry.hint: She also likes to tell us stories from her time.
Word_Entry.notes: She is Tatay's mother. She walks around with a cane.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Bunso?
Word_Entry.notes: My younger sibling. He likes to play with toys.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Tito?
Word_Entry.notes: He is Tatayâ€™s brother. He likes to drink a lot.

Word_Entry.question: Can you find Tita?
Word_Entry.hint: She likes to hang out with my mother.
Word_Entry.notes: She is Nanay's sister. She is a great cook too.
